result.execSummary:
The defendant JORDAN B MEYER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. JORDAN B MEYER is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • JORDAN B MEYER was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 8:33 AM Defendant JORDAN B MEYER in court.  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for JORDAN B MEYER.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim does not appear.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. State amends Count 2 to an ordinance, dismissed Count 1.

2:24 PM Defendant JORDAN B MEYER in court.  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for JORDAN B MEYER.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. V1 appears by Zoom video.  Offer = State to amend to forfeiture.  V1 objects to agreement between parties.  Judge questions why court should accept amendment.  Parties argue reasons for amendment.  V1 ordered to send copy of plane ticket to court.  Indicates she will be flying back on 10/22/22.  
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for JORDAN B MEYER. Request adjournment.  Defendant not eligible for DAA.  Victim rights complied with.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Jury Trial

The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.
